events.message: The insured reported a collision involving their vehicle with another car on the highway resulting in front-end damage.
Claim has been categorised as an Auto Accident case based on the initial report and keywords identifying vehicle collision.
An insurance claims agent was assigned to handle the case and coordinate the investigation process for the automobile accident.
The insured has been contacted to acknowledge receipt of the claim and confirm the details of the reported vehicle accident.
Request sent to the insured for additional documents including the police report, photos of damage, and contact details of involved parties.
The insured has promptly submitted all requested documents covering police reports, accident photos, and witness statements for review.
The claims investigation team has begun examining all submitted evidence, including vehicle damage and police documentation.
After thorough review, the investigation team completed their analysis determining liability and verifying the extent of vehicle damage.
A settlement amount has been proposed to the insured based on repair estimates and policy coverage terms for the auto accident claim.
The insured responded with positive feedback appreciating the clear communication and fair settlement offer presented.
The claim has been formally approved by the claims manager confirming coverage for the vehicle damages sustained in the accident.
Payment for the approved settlement amount was successfully issued to the insuredâ€™s bank account for vehicle repairs.
The auto accident claim has been officially closed following payment disbursement and confirmation from the insured.
